TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/Click the “continue” button to start the experiment.
A spatula is taken from the work bench.
The spatula is wiped with cotton.
A small amount of Horse Radish )eroxidase (HRP) is taken from the bottle.
4mg of HRP is weighed using weighing balance.
A microfuge tube (vial) is taken from the rack.
The vial is opened and the measured HRP is transferred in to it.
The vial is then kept in the rack.
A 1000microlitre micropipette is taken from its rack.
A 1000microlitre micropipette is taken from its rack.
A fresh tip is inserted into the micropipette.
The Bottle for Distilled water is opened and 1ml (1000 microlitre) of sterile Distilled water is pipette out.
The vial containing HRP is taken from the rack.
Distilled water is added to this vial.
The contents in the vial are mixed well.
After mixing, the vial is kept in the rack.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
The pipette is adjusted to 200 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
The vial containing 0.1M Sodium periodate is taken from the rack.
200 microlitre of 0.1M Sodium periodate is pipetted out.
The sodium periodate solution is replaced in the rack.
The vial with HRP is taken from the rack.
200 microlitres of Sodium Periodate is transferred to this vial and the contents are mixed well with the pipette. The solution turns orange in color.
The vial is then kept in the rack for 20 minutes incubation at room temperature.
After 20minutes incubation, the color of the solution turned to Green.
notext
A forceps is taken from the work bench.
A piece of dialysis tubing membrane is taken from the ethanol storage solution using the forceps.
The dialysis tubing membrane is washed with distilled water.
A dialysis tubing clamp is taken from the work bench.
The clamp is put on the dialysis membrane at one end.
The dialysis membrane is placed on a tissue paper.
A pipette is inserted in the pipette pump.
The vial having the reaction mixture is taken from the rack.
The whole solution is pipetted out from the vial.
The vial is then replaced in the rack.
The pipetted solution is transferred into the dialysis tubing membrane.
A new clamp is put in to the membrane on the other side.
The tubing membrane is placed over a tissue paper and is wiped with another tissue paper.
The tubing membrane with solution is dipped in 1mM Sodium acetate buffer.
A magnetic stir bar is taken and is put in the beaker containing the Sodium acetate buffer and the dialysis tubing membrane.
The beaker having Sodium acetate buffer, magnetic stir and dialysis tubing membrane is taken from the work bench.
Visicooler is opened and the beaker is kept on a magnetic stirrer present in the visicooler.
The stirrer is switched on and is kept overnight at 4°C. After incubation, the stirrer is switched off and the beaker is taken out.
After incubation, the stirrer is switched off and the beaker is taken out.
The beaker is kept on the work bench.
The dialysis tubing membrane is taken from the beaker.
The clamp is removed from one side.
The solution is taken out from the tubing membrane using a pasture pipette.
A small test tube is taken from the rack.
The solution is transferred into the test tube.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
A 20 microlitre micropipette is taken from its rack.
notext
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
20 microlitre of 0.2M Sodium carbonate buffer is pipette out from its bottle.
The test tube with the reaction mixture is taken from the rack.
The 0.2M Sodium carbonate solution is transferred to the test tube.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
The used tip is dropped into a waste beaker.
The 20 microlitre pipette is replaced in its rack.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A fresh tip inserted in it.
The monoclonal antibody solution placed in a centrifuge tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and 1000 microlitres (1ml) of monoclonal antibody solution are pipetted out.
The tube with monoclonal antibody solution is kept in the rack.
The test tube with monoclonal antibodies is taken from the rack.
The monoclonal antibody solution is transferred to the test tube.
After transferring the antibodies, the test tube is replaced in the rack.
A glass rod is taken from the work bench.
The glass rod is wiped with cotton thoroughly.
The test tube is taken from the rack.
The reaction mixture in the test tube is mixed well with glass rod.
After mixing, the test tube is replaced in the rack.
The test tube with reaction mixture is kept as such for incubation at room temperature for 2hours.
A 100 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack
notext
A fresh tip is inserted into the micro pipette.
A vial having Sodium borohydride solution is taken from the rack.
100 microlitre of Sodium borohydride solution is taken from the vial using the micro pipette.
The sodium borohydride solution is replaced in the rack.
The test tube with reaction mixture is taken from the rack.
The Sodium borohydride solution is transferred into the test tube and the entire solution is pipetted out with a pasture pipette.
The empty tube is replaced in the rack.
The cryo box is opened and a centrifuge tube is taken from it.
The reaction mixture is transferred to the centrifuge tube.
Then the centrifuge tube is kept in the cryo box.
notext
The freezer(4°C) is opened.
The centrifuge tube is kept in it (4°C) for 2hours.
The gel filtration column is washed with distilled water.
The Sepharose CL-6B is transferred into the column.
The PBS buffer is poured into the column.
After pouring, the PBS buffer is then removed to a waste beaker by removing the cap at the bottom of the column. After the removal of all PBS buffer, the column is recapped.
The refrigerator is opened and the cryobox having centrifuge tube is taken from it.
The box is opened and the centrifuge tube is taken from it.
notext
The reaction mixture in the centrifuge tube is poured into the column.
The empty centrifuge tube is kept in the box.
notext
The PBS buffer is again poured into the column.
The waste beaker is replaced by 4 test tubes.
The cap is removed and the solution is collected in 4 tubes. After that the column is recapped.
The rack with 4 test tubes is placed in the work bench.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A fresh tip inserted in the pipette.
1000 microlitre(1ml) of PBS buffer is pipetted from its bottle.
A cuvette for Blank (labeled as ‘B’) is taken from its rack.
1ml of PBS solution is transferred into the cuvette B.
The cuvette B is kept in the rack.
Again 1ml of PBS buffer is taken from its bottle.
Another B labeled cuvette is taken from the rack.
The PBS solution is transferred into the cuvette B.
This cuvette also kept in the rack.
The lid of the Spectrophotometer is opened.
One of the cuvettes labelled B is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is wiped with tissue paper thoroughly.
After that, this cuvette is placed in the slit situated in the spectrophotometer.
Then the second Cuvette (labeled as B) is taken from the rack.
It is wiped with tissue paper thoroughly.
This cuvette also placed in the spectrophotometer and the lid is closed.
The spectrophotometer is started.
This is the graph indicating the base line which is observed on monitor.
The lid of the spectrophotometer is opened and one of the Blank cuvettes(B) is removed.
The cuvette(B) is replaced in the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the rack.
A fresh tip is inserted in the pipette.
The test tube labeled as 1 is taken from the rack.
1ml of sample is pipetted out from the tube.
The test tube is kept in the rack.
The Test cuvette (labeled as ‘T’) is taken from the rack.
The Sample 1 is transferred into this cuvette.
The cuvette is placed in the rack.
The micropipette is replaced in its rack.
The test cuvette is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is wiped with tissue paper.
Then the cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer and is closed.
The working is started.
The resultant graph obtained is observed in the monitor.
The sample 2 is taken from the rack.
1ml of sample is taken from it.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
The test cuvette is taken from the rack.
The sample 2 is transferred into the cuvette.
The cuvette is wiped with tissue paper.
Then the cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer.
The spectrophotometer is started.
The resultant graph obtained is observed in the monitor.
The sample 3 is taken from the rack.
1ml of sample is taken from it.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
The test cuvette is taken from the rack
The sample 3 is transferred into the cuvette.
The cuvette is wiped with tissue paper.
Then the cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer.
The spectrophotometer is started.
The resultant graph obtained is observed in the monitor.
The sample 4 is taken from the rack.
1ml of sample is taken from it.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
The test cuvette is taken from the rack.
The sample 4 is transferred into the cuvette.
The cuvette is wiped with tissue paper.
Then the cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer.
The resultant graph obtained is observed in the monitor.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A 1000 microlitre micropipette is taken from the rack.
A fresh tip is inserted in the micropipette.
The sample 1 is taken from the rack.
The entire sample is pipette out.
The test tube is replaced in the rack.
The sample 2 is taken from the rack.
The sample 1 is transferred into the test tube with sample 2.
The test tube labeled as sample 2 is replaced in the rack.
A 3000 microlitre micropipette is taken.
A fresh tip is inserted in the micropipette.
3000 microlitre of 50% Glycerol is taken from the bottle.
A Cryo vial is taken from a cryo box.
The 50% glycerol is transferred into the cryo vial.
The vial is then replaced in the cryo box.
The used tip is discarded in the waste beaker.
A fresh tip is inserted in the pipette.
The test tube labeled as 2 is taken from the rack.
The whole solution in the test tube is pipetted out.
The empty test tube is kept in the rack.
The cryo vial is taken from the box.
The whole solution is transferred into the cryo vialand the whole solution in the vial is observed.
The vial is kept in the box.
A piece of parafilm is cut from the parafilm roll.
The outer covering is removed.
The cryo vial is taken from the box.
The vial is wrapped with parafilm properly.
The wrapped cryo vial with labeled sample (Antibody) is kept in the cryo box.
The -20 digree freezer is opened and the cryo box with vial is kept in it.
notext
